evaluation.answer: For a claim submission involving robotic surgery for your spouse, you will need a duly completed claim form, photo ID, age proof, health card, policy copy, KYC documents, the attending medical practitioner's/surgeon's certificate detailing diagnosis/operation, test reports, patient's medical history, all previous consultation papers, detailed hospital bills with break-up, payment receipts, and the discharge certificate/summary. To confirm if "Apollo Care Hospital" is a network provider, refer to the booklet provided by the TPA or check the updated list available on the company's website (uiic.co.in/en/tpa-ppn-...). A sibling above 26 cannot continue as a dependent, as the policy explicitly defines eligible family members as Self, legal spouse, and Children only.

To replace a lost ID card for another dependent, as the policy documents do not detail this process, you should contact the TPA directly for guidance.

evaluation.answer: Yes, your 17-year-old son's psychiatric illness admission to a hospital outside your city is covered for in-patient treatment, as the policy includes a 'Mental Illness Cover Limit' for specified mental disorders without geographical restrictions within India. To update your family's address, you must submit a written request to the insurer for a formal endorsement. Regarding OPD dental checkups, the policy offers 'Dental Expenses Cover' if opted for, but it primarily details orthodontic treatment and does not specify coverage for routine OPD dental checkups under Gold or Platinum plans, as such plan distinctions are not detailed in this document.

Additionally, any amounts already paid by the insurer for that claim must be repaid by you or the policyholder. The company also reserves the right to cancel your policy due to such fraud, without any refund of premium.
